Group Compliance Business Partner - 12-month fixed-term

Company Name Medibank Company Location 720 Bourke Street Docklands Melbourne, Victoria, VIC 3008, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.


We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians.


About Us

We're passionate about nurturing careers.


We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Opportunity


As a Compliance Business Partner you will collectively support the implementation and operation of Medibank’s Compliance Management System – a set of activities and interacting elements that together enable Medibank to meet its commitment to Compliance.

In this role you will ensure Medibank’s Compliance Management System remains embedded, useful, simple and sustainable, so that Medibank manages its compliance risk effectively.


Key responsibilities will include:

- Developing, implementing and supporting the Compliance Management System collaboratively with the team

- Championing a strong compliance culture at Medibank

-\xa0 Providing expert compliance advice and support to the business, particularly on complex matters

- Identify opportunities to improve the way Group Compliance manages and maintains the obligation register and process, and work with other team members to implement these

- Undertaking second line compliance monitoring and assurance activities.

\xa0

About You

\xa0

In order to be successful in this role, you will have proven experience in risk and compliance, strong problem-solving skills, and analytical capability, able to identify trends and interpret information quickly and accurately.

\xa0

You also have demonstrated relationship and stakeholder management experience with an ability to influence and negotiate change within a large organisation. We are looking for someone with broad exposure to corporate risk and compliance-related matters and a strong understanding of how to effectively achieve both tactical and operational outcomes.

\xa0

Prior experience in regulated environments will be highly regarded.

\xa0

What We Offer

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.

\xa0

After customers purchase our products, you’re the one who helps them get more out of their new Apple technology. Your day in the Apple Store is filled with a range of focused support and service tasks. Whether you’re helping customers get started with the Mac or finding answers to their questions about other Apple devices, you’re ready to share knowledge and provide exceptional assistance. You gain satisfaction from bringing resolution and insight to each customer, elevating his or her relationship with Apple to the next level.

Description

As a Technical Specialist, you help new owners get started and current ones get quick, efficient support — developing strong, positive relationships with Apple. When a customer needs assistance, you quickly assess their situation. Sometimes you take care of customers with advice or a solution on the spot, using your knowledge of current Apple technology to help with iPod, iPhone and iPad devices. At other times, you refer customers to Support team members who get them up and running again. You even provide personal training for new customers, helping them acquire the basic skills they need to get started on photo, video and music projects. The entire store team benefits from your commitment to providing the best care for customers. By helping Apple maintain strong relationships with customers, you are instrumental to our success.

Lead Commissioning Engineer - Substations
Job ID: 554429
Job type: Full Time - Permanent
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Engineering (All disciplines), Construction

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Position Summary

Our Infrastructure Services Division operates three business units: Road Services; Infrastructure Projects and Utilities. As we continue our evolution of growth and innovation, the best people are critical to our success in supporting our customers and catering to market demands.

Downer Utilities Has Been Successful In Securing And Delivering a Number Of Exciting Large- Scale Power And Water Infrastructure Projects Including
  • Transmission and Distribution Substations and power lines;
  • Wind Farms;
  • Utility Scale Solar Farms (>100MW); and
  • Waste Water Treatment Plants.

To capitalise on newly created opportunities within Power and Renewables team, Downer is seeking to appoint a Lead Commissioning Engineer - Substations for our Collins Street, Melbourne office on a full-time permanent basis.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Commissioning Manager, the Lead Commissioning Engineer will be responsible for conducting electrical testing and commissioning whilst managing a small team of test technicians for Renewables, Rail and Power Substation projects within VIC. The role is responsible for the technical aspects (functions) throughout the project lifecycle from capture to close-out and leading a small team.

About You
  • Demonstrated experience in electrical testing and final commissioning of primary, secondary electrical equipment and protection systems including SCADA and communications equipment
  • Experience in providing subject matter expertise for technical functions for all phases (identification, capture, delivery and close).
  • Proven positive customer relationship experience and ability to build strong customer relationships that result in repeat business opportunities
  • Experience in a wide range of plant and equipment at various voltage levels including fault investigation, diagnostic activities and rectification of faults within their competence
  • Relevant industry qualifications
  • Team leadership skills


What We Offer
  • The opportunity to work in the renewables, rail and utilities sectors
  • The ability to build your professional career in a multi-disciplined business environment.
  • A supportive and dynamic team environment.
  • Great employee benefits.


How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the Apply button.

For more information about the role, please contact: Sanjay Kumar, Talent & Sourcing Business Partner on 0418 621 926 or via email sanjay.kumar2@Downergroup.com (Please note that applications will not be accepted via email. Please submit your application via the advertisement.

Employer Liaison Officer

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Employer Liaison Officer
Job no: 570803
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Human Resources, Education
  • Melbourne CBD Location
  • Full time, continuing position
  • $85,065 + 17% super

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

The Education Portfolio is headed by the Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education and Vice President who leads the planning and implementation of the University’s strategies related to RMIT’s academic programs and the RMIT student experience. The Portfolio is responsible for services to support the quality of RMIT programs, including the professional development of academic staff, continuous improvement of the student experience, learning and teaching outcomes and the management of learning and research information sources.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Employer Liaison Officer develops employer relationships which maximise student employment opportunities, including Work Integrated Learning (WIL) for RMIT’s diverse student and graduate community locally and globally. This position has a high level of day-to-day autonomy and is responsible for the identification and implementation of innovative strategically targeted employer services. The position is also responsible for the development, marketing and delivery of a range of global employment activities and events that will position students to be successful in clarifying and achieving their career and employment objectives. This position involves close collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team and consultation with key stakeholders, including local and global employers, professional associations, government agencies and other relevant internal and external stakeholders.

Skills & Experience Required

You will maximise local and global employment opportunities available to RMIT students and graduates and develop, market and implement a range of strategically targeted global employment services, events and resources in both face-to-face and online environments. You will be confident in your communication and networking skills to develop and support relationships with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders including global employers, industry and professional networks, community organisations and RMIT students, alumni and staff. Important to this role will be your ability to identify, develop and implement a range of innovative face-to-face and online global employment services, events, resources and opportunities that are targeted and responsive to stakeholders needs. Your capacity to think and work innovatively, effectively and flexibly in a multi-disciplinary team environment will be imperative to your success in this role.

A record of achievements in a relevant work area such as marketing, recruitment, human resources management or employment services within a tertiary institution would be valued.

Note: Appointment to this position is subject to passing a Working with Children check.

To Apply

To view a position description, please see below or for further information please contact Adam Rowland on +61 3 9925 4767 using reference 570803.

Position Description - Employer Liaison Officer.pdf

Applications close on 24 October 2018.

Applicants must separately address the key selection criteria as outlined in the Position Description.

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

Application close: 24 Oct 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time

Job description

Description
  • Great Exposure to High Profile Accounts & Iconic Brand
  • 19 hours weekly, preferred days are Tuesday to Friday
  • Within South Yarra / Richmond / Hawthorn / Camberwell / Prahran Areas

Mondelez International, Inc. is one of the world’s largest snacks companies, with 2017 net revenues of approximately $26 billion. Our purpose and vision is to create more moments of joy by building the best snacking company in the world. Over 80,000 employees support this effort by manufacturing and marketing delicious food and beverage products for consumers in approximately 160 countries around the world. We are world leaders in biscuits, chocolate, gum, candy and powdered beverages and have famous brands across the Asia Pacific region, including Cadbury, Pascall, Oreo, Trident, The Natural Confectionery Company and Tang.

We’re constantly changing and innovating and we are seeking a Merchandiser that will be responsible for driving profitable growth of the business through the implementation and maintenance of store standards. Working within a focused sales team that is led by the Regional Manager (RM), the role will be performing merchandising activities across and existing customer base at the direction of the Territory Manager and Regional Manager. Also, the position can operate in all channels to ensure the optimum presence of Mondelez Products at the point of purchase and should provide in store merchandising activity in each outlet.

Some of the key accountabilities for this role will include (but are not limited to)
  • Ensure monthly on full year targets delivered within relevant channel against the “Ssentials Store Procedure, Store Standards, Strike Rate, Sales."
  • Review weekly Journey Plans to ensure upcoming territory call frequency and objectives are achieved.
  • Ensure appropriate POS is available for all day-to-day planned activity and also to take advantage of opportune activity.
  • Complete Field reporting requirements via FSS in line with Mondelez expectations (Non Compliance, Action items, Priorities, Events and Profiles).
  • Ensure all paperwork is completed on time and sent to the state office by the designated time schedule.
  • Direct contact with Regional Manager and Territory Manager for all leave requirements, including workday variations.

Qualifications

Do you have what it takes?

To be successful as our new Merchandiser, you will have experience in sales and/or customer service, ideally in the FMCG environment. On required occasions demonstrate ability to use various “selling” strategies to up sell and cross sell whilst utilising effective negotiation skills. You will have sound problem solving and decision making skills, clear and effective communication skills and a proven ability to work autonomously whilst contributing to a team outcome. You must hold a valid current driver’s license with proven safe driving record. Have your own vehicle covered by comprehensive insurance.

Please note All candidates must have work rights of this country to perform the role.

902398345:
[

Expression of Interest - Aboriginal Workforce - West Gate Tunnel Project

Company Name CPB Contractors Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

CPBJH JV is committed to maximising employment and training for Aboriginal people. Those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to express interest in all available roles on the project here.

About CPBJH JV

CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.

The Joint Venture was awarded the contract to design and construct the West Gate Tunnel Project.

About The Project

The West Gate Tunnel Project is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. It will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include:
  • Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road;
  • Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville;
  • Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge;
  • Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne; and
  • Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.

Aboriginal Employment

CPBJH JV is committed to maximising employment and training for Aboriginal people and we have committed to 2.5% of Project labour hours by Aboriginal workers.

People who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to express interest in all available roles on the project from labourers, plant operators and construction supervisors to administrative, engineering, design, commercial and finance roles.

Most roles will be based in the western suburbs at a number of sites along the project corridor.

These roles will provide successful candidates with the opportunity to join a rapidly growing industry with long term employment and career development prospects, not only on the West Gate Tunnel Project, but on future projects throughout Victoria and Australia.

Please note: Applying to this Expression of Interest (EOI) is not an application to a specific role or position, however your application will be reviewed against current vacancies and any future vacancies when they become available.

To review our current open vacancies please visit http://careers.wgtp.com.au where we also encourage you to apply directly to any roles you may be interested in.

CPBJH JV is committed to equal employment opportunity (EEO) and actively seeks to remove barriers that Aboriginal people face in gaining successful employment. We value diversity in our team and people who share our values of authenticity, respect and excellence are encouraged to apply.

CPBJH JV acknowledge the traditional custodians of the land on which we work and pay our respects to elders past, present and future.

This advertisement is intended to constitute a special/equal opportunity measure under section 8(1) of the Racial Discrimination Act 1975 (Cth), and s 12 of the Equal Opportunity Act 2010 (Vic) and s 8(4) of the Charter of Human Rights and Responsibilities Act 2006 (Vic).

Company Name Chase Resourcing International Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Chase Resourcing are delighted to announce we are recruiting Education Advisors for a major client to relocate to Saudi Arabia.


We would like to speak with any candidates with senior management experience within Technical and Vocational Education and Training in the United Kingdom.


Education Advisors will be supporting the Vice-President Education and the wider Education team to develop the capacity of the company to deliver appropriate education advice to college providers and employers through:


Promoting Active dialogues\xa0– to engage in positive and productive improvement dialogues about performance and Strategic Partnership colleges and make appropriate interventions where necessary.


Capacity building –to assist training providers to develop their capacity to deliver through positive communication, coaching, mentoring and sharing best practice rather than through inspection and evaluation.


Gathering and disseminating best practices – to ensure sharing of best practice and innovation to the widest audience within colleges and Strategic Partners.


Review and benchmark our practice – regularly review and update our practice and interventions against best international standards


Participating in Performance Review – liaising with the Contracts team in performance issue discussions and requirements for contract termination.

\xa0

Responsibilities of Education Advisors


  1. To provide advice and guidance to colleges to improve teaching and learning effectiveness, leadership strategy and management practice.
  2. To convene and facilitate curriculum focus groups with specialist subject and lead committees comprising college leaders, academic managers and teachers to improve the quality and delivery of our programs.
  3. To conduct regular site visits to training providers in addition to video and conference call meetings.
  4. To facilitate and lead professional development, consultations and training with training providers and employers as appropriate.
  5. To be able to identify and understand the scale and extent of the challenges and opportunities that face client and training providers during this critical phase of development and contribute to the development of appropriate solutions to achieve success.
  6. To provide high quality reports and other documents in English and Arabic.
  7. To maintain accurate and up to date reports on progress to the Vice-President Education via the Senior Education Manager.
  8. To keep accurate records and provide business administration support.
  9. To liaise with major stakeholders in the Kingdom
  10. To liaise with other departments to ensure consistent and effective communication.
  11. To attend Education team meetings and other meetings as appropriate.
  12. To continue to update own knowledge and skills in relation to the job responsibilities and contribute to conferences, seminars and workshops including publishing articles on best practice.


Requirements needed for role of Education Advisors


  • Teaching qualification from a recognized teacher training authority
  • Higher degree in Education or Education Management from a recognized university
  • 10 years teaching experience gained in a relevant tertiary college in home country.
  • At least 5 years progressively senior experience of academic/ student support services /administrative management at SMT level within a post-secondary education system
  • Fluency in English & Knowledge of Arabic
  • Good communication and presentation skills
  • Wide knowledge of education best practice and an ability to work with college management, academic managers and teachers in the spirit of engagement and partnership
  • An appreciation of the importance of education and training to the future of the Kingdom
  • An ability to contribute to the curriculum development of one or more of the major curriculum areas
  • International experience gained in KSA or the Middle East region
  • Computer literate in all MS Office applications
  • Personal commitment to Continuous Professional Development and maintaining own learning and development.
  • An understanding and commercial appreciation of working within a PPP model in the private sector.
  • Ability and willingness to travel across Saudi Arabia as necessary.


If you are interested in the role of Education Advisors please send copy of your resume to Jason.OGrady@Chase.ie or call Jason on 00353 (0)66 9762007

Job description

We did it! We ranked #5 in the 2018 Best Places to Work study for Australia!


THE ROLE YOU COULD PLAY

Are you motivated, customer centric, commercially savvy & have what it takes to grow the MECCA Brands online business to be the #1 Beauty Destination in ANZ? We are looking for an eCommerce Merchandise & Trading Manager, to manage the on-site experience end to end, including product management, promotions, campaign execution, user flow and UX, in order to create a best in class online experience for our customers. Your proactive approach to developing new ideas, improvements and solutions will be called upon on day one, when you bring your in-depth understanding of trends in the eCommerce space, retail market and beauty industry in supporting and growing brand awareness. This is an exciting opportunity to lead a committed and high performing team, whilst being in the thick of the action as you work side by side with some of the best in the business to create change.


WE THINK YOU WOULD BE PERFECT IF…

At MECCA, we live and breathe our values every day, and we get excited about jumping out of bed to fulfil our purpose of enabling our customers to look and feel their best. Our culture is welcoming, supportive and energetic but we also have high expectations for all our MECCA-mazing team members. If you approach life with the attitude that nothing is a problem and there is a solution for everything, and you take pride in being exceptional at your job, then you will fit right in!

Our unique and positive culture ensures team members are surrounded by other incredible and inspiring people, amazing opportunities, experiences and challenges, enabling them to be the best they can be in everything they choose to do.


We’ll never be finished making MECCA the best place to work – we’re only just getting started!\xa0

The Company

ASX listed, DuluxGroup is a manufacturer and marketer of products that protect, maintain and enhance the places and spaces in which we live and work. Our iconic brands: Dulux, Selleys, Yates, Cabot's, B&D Doors & Openers, Parchem, ATA, Lincoln Sentry and Porter's Paints have been woven into the fabric of the communities where we operate.

The Role

Based in our modern corporate head office in Clayton, this exciting role joins our internal Creative team under the leadership of the Team Manager. As one of our Multimedia Designers you will be responsible for producing, shooting and editing video elements for multimedia design projects. However, the role extends to photography, animation and 3D where required. You will work closely with internal customers to transform their briefs into practical and aesthetic media outputs.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with an established and close-knit team, who strive themselves on high quality, creative outcomes.

Selection Criteria

We are looking for a vibrant and energetic person with a can-do attitude, a deep sense of ownership and a desire to see a task through to finish. This role requires the ability to work within timeframes while adhering to brand guidelines. We are looking for a candidate who is creative thinker, a problem solver and is committed to delivering high quality results.

In addition, the ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience;

  • Must have tertiary qualification in Multimedia Design, Film / Photography or Animation;
  • Minimum four years of industry-based film, photography and editing experience;
  • Ability to work autonomously on projects and collaborate within a team environment;
  • Strong creative and design skills;
  • Strong communication and presentation skills to pitch your ideas to prospective clients;
  • Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative suite, After Effects, Premiere, Illustrator, Photoshop;
  • Strong video production capabilities including camera and sound production skills;
  • Skills in Audition would be highly advantageous;
  • Skills in animation and 3D would be highly advantageous.

How to Apply

To submit your application please click 'Apply' below or for a confidential discussion please call Kylie on 03 9263 5706. For further information about DuluxGroup please visit our website www.duluxgroup.com.au

We are on the lookout for an experienced Lead Developer, with strong skills across SQL and PowerBI. This is a permanent role with a finacial service company based in the CBD.

This role is the key person in the delivery and enhancement of customer specific reporting for our products. They must work closely with multiple stakeholders, including technology teams to ensure that we successfully meet reporting obligations.

Job description

Sales Executive

Location: CBD & Inner Suburbs > Melbourne

Worktype: Full Time
Salary: $60000 to $70000
Profession / Role: Business Services > Business Development Manager (BDM)

Description

What's in it for you?

Feel valued as an employee and learn directly from company founders. The salary on offer is a base of $60k + super + company credit card and uncapped commissions. You can reasonably earn $100k+ OTE in your first year on the job and the top sales performer is bringing in $130k! One of the biggest benefits of this opportunity is who you will be working for and learning from. Gain support from both the sales team and management to further your sales skills and business acumen.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be selling a range of advertising solutions in both print and digital format. The offering is unique in the market and already has significant market saturation. Sell a business advertising solution that is already widely read by their target market. You can work from their open-plan office and/or home to get the most out of every day. You will also have the chance to get out in front of your clients as much as possible for a varied workweek.

Who You Will Be Doing It For

Join this Australian business and they grow further their national presence. The founders started the company after completing their own education and discovering a gap in the market. Since then, they have successfully grown their offering and audience in just a few years. They have an open office in Sydney's inner-south suburbs and will drive your career where you want to take it.

What You Must Have To Apply For This Role
  • Proven success in new business generation and cold calling sales
  • Experience selling to business decision makers
  • Completed tertiary studies or similar


You Will Be Highly Regarded If You Also Have
  • Had experience selling an education or advertising solution
  • Dealt with decision makers in educational organisations

All you should do to apply for this exciting role is to submit your resume to Ali McCormack via the "Apply Now" button below. Send your CV ASAP, as I will be screening applicants from the moment this ad goes live. If you want to know more about this unique opportunity or similar sales roles, you can call me for a confidential chat on my direct dial 03 9283 9075.

Please note: due to the volume of applications, only successful applicants will be contacted.

Business Analysts - Superannuation Project Delivery

IQ Group

IQ Group has supported Superannuation and Wealth Management clients through unprecedented change for more than 15 years in Australia. From our offices in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane, over 100\xa0specialist consultants assist clients improve their operations and use of technology. Our clients benefit from IQ Group's domain experience and commitment to project delivery. IQ Group is part of a global company with other offices in South Africa.

The Opportunities

IQ Group is undergoing an exciting period of growth, and have been engaged as the partner of choice to deliver a number of strategic programs on behalf of our customers.\xa0 As a result, we are currently seeking Business Analysts to uplift our Business Analyst consulting capability in our Melbourne Practice, based in the CBD.

Successful candidates must demonstrate the following skills:\xa0

  • Knowledge of the superannuation system & fund administration concepts
  • Experienced in the delivery of superannuation projects - across compliance/legislative change, platforms/systems, successor fund transfers & migrations, product change and process design
  • Excellent interpersonal skills\xa0- facilitation/engagement/communication skills
  • Knowledge of project delivery methodologies (Agile, Waterfall)
  • Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio

Your Capability:

  • Workshop facilitation with project stakeholders
  • Business analysis and documenting business requirements;
  • Business process mapping & process re-engineering
  • Ability to assist project team members during the delivery lifecycle

\xa0Why IQ Group?

Our purpose is to nurture and support a team who share our passion for delivering solutions that accelerate change and improve our clients' business results. \xa0As an IQ Group Consultant, you will have the chance to make an impact in the development of complex solutions for a wide range of organisations whilst working alongside and learning from other knowledgeable and experienced consultants.\xa0 You may also have the opportunity to travel interstate and collaborate with your interstate colleagues.\xa0

If you're keen to join a dynamic and progressive organisation on the forefront of the financial services sector please apply now via the link below:

There will be a number of positions, please select the appropriate one in your desired location(s).

We look forward to hearing from you.
